intro: Spermacoce neotenuis, commonly known as the slender velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Spermacoce neotenuis typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
